_description.$comment: Underscore to keep JSON Schema validator functioning

source.$comment: Fixed field, only valid value is fmu.

version.$comment: Must always be on root level.
version.title: FMU results metadata version
version.$comment: This is 0.8.0, so require version to be == 0.8.0

name.description: Name of the data object. If stratigraphic, match the entry in the stratigraphic column

stratigraphic.$comment: Determines of validation against strat column should happen or not
stratigraphic.description: True if data object represents an entity in the stratigraphic column

offset.$comment: To be used if data represents an offset from the specified name
e.g. a surface representing an offset from a known horizon

top.$comment: To be used if data object is an interval

base.$comment: To be used if data object is an interval

content.description: The contents of this data object

tagname.description: A semi-human readable tag for internal usage and uniqueness

properties.$comment: This is not the JSON Schema properties, this is FMU properties
properties.description: data.properties is an array of property objects, representing the properties present in the data object.

undef_is_zero.description: Flag if undefined values are to be interpreted as zero

undef.$comment: How is the undefined value represented?

npolys.description: The number of individual polygons in the data object

columns.description: List of columns present in a table.

is_prediction.title: Is prediction flag
is_prediction.$comment: For flagging predictions, and separating them from non-predictions

is_observation.title: Is observation flag
is_observation.$comment: For flagging observations, and separating them from non-observations

contact.$comment: Not sure if wise to enum this

truncated.$comment: Is this contact truncated to the stratigraphy?

color.description: The color of the contour lines

increment.description: The contour increment in same values as the data

colormap.$comment: colormap can be given alongside fill.color. Clients must choose.

display_min.description: The low-side boundary to use for fill color

display_max.description: The high-side boundary to use for fill color

access_level.$comment: 'asset' is legacy, but will be allowed in a transition

masterdata.$comment: Block holds references to master data

country.$comment: Array of SMDA-valid countries. First entry is primary.

discovery.$comment: Array of SMDA-valid discoveries. First entry is primary.

field.$comment: Array of SMDA-valid (oil & gas) fields. First entry is primary.

description.description: This is a free text description of the model setup

reference.description: Reference to the part of the FMU workflow that produced this

user.description: The user name used in ERT

name.description: The convential name of this iteration, e.g. iter-0 or pred

id.description: The internal identification of this iteration, e.g. the iteration number

restart_from.description: A uuid reference to another iteration that this iteration was restarted from

realization.$comment: Some schema repetition between realization and aggregation

name.description: The convential name of this iteration, e.g. iter-0 or pred

id.description: The unique number of this realization as used in FMU

jobs.description: Content directly taken from the ERT jobs.json file for this realization

aggregation.$comment: Some schema repetition between realization and aggregation

realization_ids.description: Array of realization ids included in this aggregation

id.$comment: Used for tying together representations of the same entity
Example: Statistics for various time steps of the same surface
Not used in Drogon but widely used on e.g. Johan Sverdrup
Used for enabling common display and joint visual settings
A unique uuid is currently used, and included as example but any ID should be sufficient

context.description: The internal FMU context in which this data object was produced

file.description: Block describing the file as the data appear in FMU context
file.$comment: While the file may seize to exist, the concept is still useful
A lot of logic exists on top of the file name now, legacy but not likely to disappear soon

relative_path.description: The file path relative to RUNPATH

checksum_md5.description: md5 checksum of the file or bytestring

size_bytes.description: Size of file object in bytes

$comment: oneOf below reflects different structures depending on type
The fmu-block is different for cases and data objects,
and the data block is only present for data objects.

fmu.description: The FMU block records properties that are specific to FMU
fmu.$comment: This is the fmu block as it appears in data objects

fmu.description: The FMU block records properties that are specific to FMU
fmu.$comment: This is the fmu block as it appears in data objects
implementation below allows realization or aggregation or none of them, never both
